body_html:
So, I did some testing, and found out this (some rough numbers):

  • SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (Cython implementation) is faster than SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (ATen implementation) by 100 if dimension = 4
  • SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (Cython implementation) is faster than SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (ATen implementation) by 20 if dimension = 50
  • SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (Cython implementation) is faster than SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (ATen implementation) by 10 if dimension = 100
  • SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (Cython implementation) is faster than SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (ATen implementation) by 2 if dimension = 1000

I am thinking that the __xor__ operator for Tensors is at fault.

So, I did some testing, and found out this (some rough numbers):

SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (Cython implementation) is faster than SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (ATen implementation) by 100 if dimension = 4
SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (Cython implementation) is faster than SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (ATen implementation) by 20 if dimension = 50
SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (Cython implementation) is faster than SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (ATen implementation) by 10 if dimension = 100
SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (Cython implementation) is faster than SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000) (ATen implementation) by 2 if dimension = 1000

I am thinking that the __xor__ operator for Tensors is at fault.
body:
So, I did some testing, and found out this (some rough numbers):
+ `SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000)` (Cython implementation) is faster than `SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000)` (ATen implementation) by **100** if `dimension` = 4
+ `SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000)` (Cython implementation) is faster than `SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000)` (ATen implementation) by **20** if `dimension` = 50
+ `SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000)` (Cython implementation) is faster than `SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000)` (ATen implementation) by **10** if `dimension` = 100
+ `SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000)` (Cython implementation) is faster than `SobolEngine.fast_forward(n = 1000)` (ATen implementation) by **2** if `dimension` = 1000

I am thinking that the `__xor__` operator for `Tensor`s is at fault.
